We appreciate your interest in our Naked Pea Protein and hope you will consider giving it a try despite the changes.

templates.content:
We generally recommend our Naked Shake protein since it mixes easily, tastes great, and contains MCT oil which has numerous health benefits in addition to increasing satiation so you feel fuller: https://nakednutrition.com/products/vegan-protein-shake

We also recommend Naked Whey or Naked Pea but for both, make sure you're getting your daily value of vitamins and minerals such as adding vegetables when blending.

templates.content: The facilities where all the ingredients are processed and packaged do have FDA approval.
templates.name: Are your products FDA approved?

templates.content: At this time, our products are not NSF Certified. We have opted for the Informed Choice Trusted by Sport certification. This is a monitoring program that certifies that a supplement product and/or raw material has been tested at least on a monthly basis for banned substances by LGC's world-class sports anti-doping lab.
templates.name: Are your products NSF certified?

templates.content: Our processing and packaging facilities are all GMP certified. Silliker is the 3rd party auditor for this certification. Regarding stability studies, since we only sell powders and nothing in a solution, like a beverage, stability studies are not necessary.
templates.name: Are your facilities GMP certified? Who does the GMP audit? Do you do stability testing?

templates.content: We do not sell any dairy-based proteins that are lactose-free. However, goat whey is known to react differently than whey from cow's milk since the lactose in goats' milk is different than the lactose in cows' milk.
templates.name: Do you sell any lactose free dairy protein products?

templates.content: Our protein powders are extremely easy to use in baking. The powder can infuse some extra nutritional power into the meal, and it can often be used as a substitute for flour. Our blog has a number of shake and protein baking recipes: https://nakednutrition.com/blogs/recipes
templates.name: Can I bake with your protein powders?

templates.content:
We recommend our Naked Mass, which contains only three ingredients: organic maltodextrin, naked whey, and naked casein, or our Naked Vegan Mass which also contains only three ingredients: organic maltodextrin, naked pea, and naked rice.

Both have no artificial sweeteners, flavors, or colors. Also consider our Naked Whey and Naked Casein separately, in that way you will not have any maltodextrin included.

templates.content: Our whey products tend to foam a bit more than most because they do not contain lecithin. To combat this, we recommend blending all the ingredients of your shake first and then reducing the blending time to 10-15 seconds if you want to avoid the foam.
templates.name: Why does naked whey foam so much?

templates.content:
The best protein powder for muscle gain needs to be a complete, high-quality protein that contains high concentrations of that valuable protein. There should be few additives if any, and you should know their purpose.

Naked Whey can be a great choice for adding protein to your diet. Naked Casein is also great before bed to ensure your body has protein while you sleep. For vegans, Naked Pea is a great option.
templates.name: Which protein should I use for muscle gain?

templates.content: As long as the outer seal is intact, you have nothing to worry about. When our containers are opened, the second seal sometimes will come up because of the way the seal is placed in the lid before sealing. In other words, the seal breaking once you unscrew the lids is perfectly normal. There would only be cause for concern if there is protein powder in the box itself.
templates.name: Is the product okay if the inside seal has been broken? Has the product been tampered with?

templates.content:
Here's an article on the Best Protein For Muscle Gain: https://nakednutrition.com/blogs/fitness/best-protein-powder-for-muscle-gain and an article on How Grass-Fed Whey Helps Build Muscle: https://nakednutrition.com/blogs/protein/how-grass-fed-protein-powder-helps-build-muscle

In short, we recommend whey protein provided you have no issues with lactose. In that case, pea or a combination of egg protein or pea and rice protein is ideal.
templates.name: How to lose weight but gain muscle and which protein to use?

templates.content: We do not test for PCBs at this time.
templates.name: Do you test for PCBs?

templates.content: The gluten test is only able to test the presence of gluten to a certain level. This test detects gluten when it is more than 0.0005% of the sample. Since there is gluten found, the result is that there is less than 0.15mg per 30 grams. In other words, no gluten was detected, but the test is unable to say that there is 0% gluten, instead it can say there is less than 0.0005% gluten. The FDA standard for gluten-free is less than 20ppm, and our test shows there is less than 5ppm.
templates.name: Why does your testing show the presence of gluten?

templates.content:
Our Naked Whey comes from cow's milk and contains lactose. With a mild allergy, we generally recommend our Naked Goat, which has a different form of lactose that is easier on the stomach.

If you are looking for a vegan protein, you can find our vegan line here: https://nakednutrition.com/collections/vegan-protein-powder
templates.name: I have a mild dairy allergy. What is the best product for me that you offer?

templates.content: All of our products that do not contain nuts are processed in a nut and soy-free facility. However, they are packaged on lines that also package both soy and nuts. The lines are thoroughly disinfected and cleaned between runs to avoid any cross contamination.
templates.name: Are our products produced in a soy and nut free facility?

templates.content: Our proteins and supplements are sold by weight and not by the amount of space they take up i.e. volume. Some proteins are denser than others. For example, our Naked Pea is much denser than our whey protein, and this leads to a less than completely full canister. The products are weighted multiple times to ensure it is the correct size.
templates.name: Why is my naked protein or supplement container not full?

templates.content: You can find more information about how many times to take protein in our blog here: https://nakednutrition.com/blogs/protein/how-many-times-day-take-protein

templates.content: Most of our products are processed in nut and soy-free facilities. However, they are packaged on lines that also package both soy and nuts. These lines are thoroughly disinfected and cleaned between runs to avoid any cross-contamination. There are images on our website and Amazon product listings that include the most recent gluten testing. Regarding your question, we do not use ingredients that contain gluten, but we also test for its presence.
templates.name: Are your products safe for those with a nut and gluten allergy?
